revision.text:
{{infobox military conflict |conflict = Siege of Base 46
حصار الفوج 46 |partof = the [[Syrian Civil War]] |image = |caption = |date = 22 September – 19 November 2012 |place = [[Urum al-Sughra]], [[Syria]] |coordinates = {{coord|36.125709|N|36.887927|E|format=dms|region:SY_scale:50000_type:event|display=inline,title}} |map_type = |map_relief = |latitude = |longitude = |map_size = |map_marksize = |map_caption = |map_label = |territory = |result = Rebel victory * FSA capture Base 46 in mid-November 2012 following a two-month siege |status = |combatant1 = {{flagdeco|Syria|1932}} [[Free Syrian Army]] ---- {{flagicon image|Flag of Jihad.svg}} [[Mujahideen]] *Fajr al-Islam |combatant2 = {{flagdeco|Syria}} '''[[Syrian Arab Republic]]''' *{{flagicon image|Flag of the Syrian Arab Armed Forces.svg}} [[Syrian Armed Forces]] |commander1 = {{flagicon|Syria|1932}} [[Abdul Jabbar al-Oqaidi]] (main FSA commander in Aleppo){{cite news|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/world/story/2012/12/06/f-vp-bedard-syrian-rebels.html?cmp=rss|title=Free Syrian Army an uneasy mix of religious extremes|last=Bédard|first=Marie-Ève|date=7 December 2012|publisher=CBC News|accessdate=7 December 2012}}
{{flagicon|Syria|1932}} Ahmad al-Fajj |commander2 = Unknown |units1 = Unknown |units2 = 46th Army Regiment |strength1 = 1,500 fighters |strength2 = 350 soldiers (in base)
6 tanks captured |strength3 = |casualties1 = Unknown |casualties2 = nearly 300 killed, 60 captured (rebel claim) |casualties3 = |campaignbox = {{Campaignbox Battle of Aleppo}} }} The '''Siege of Base 46''' ({{lang-ar|حصار الفوج 46}}) was a [[siege]] of the [[Syrian Army]] base at [[Urum al-Sughra]] by opposition forces waged from late September 2012 until 19 November 2012 as part of the [[Syrian Civil War]].{{cite news|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2012/10/14/oukwd-uk-syria-crisis-idAFBRE89B0XJ20121014|title=Turkey bans Syrian planes from its air space|last=MacSwan|first=Angus|author2=Khaled Yacoub Oweis |date=14 October 2012|publisher=Reuters|accessdate=22 November 2012}} It ended on 19 November 2012 after opposition forces stormed and captured Base 46, in what is considered a key strategic victory for FSA forces operating in northern Syria. ==Background== Located southeast of rebel-held [[Atarib]] near the crossroads village of Urum al-Sughra on the main highway between [[Turkey]] and [[Aleppo]], Base 46 covers an area of {{convert|12|km2|mi2}} on a hilltop. A major supply and command centre for government forces operating in northwest Syria, it is considered possibly the largest base of its kind in northern Syria. The base takes its name from the resident 46th Regiment of the [[15th Division (Syria)|15th Special Forces Division]], one of the main government units fighting in the [[Battle of Aleppo (2012–present)|Battle of Aleppo]].{{cite news|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/video/middleeast/2012/11/20121119155411532198.html|title=Rebels capture key Syrian military base|date=19 November 2012|publisher=Al Jazeera English|accessdate=20 November 2012}} Base 46 has been described as "a strategic prize in the battle for Aleppo", as it occupies a [[chokepoint]] on the main army supply route from Idlib to Aleppo. It has been used to shell towns and villages throughout Idlib and Aleppo provinces. ==Siege== The siege began in late September as a force of 1,500 fighters, mainly from Aleppo and Idlib provinces, was assembled under the command of General Ahmad al-Fajj to capture the base. Al-Fajj, a defector, notably banned Islamists from joining his force.{{cite news|url=http://www.dailystar.com.lb/News/Middle-East/2012/Oct-09/190657-syrian-army-base-46-keeps-rebels-at-bay.ashx#axzz2CufwPDdP|title=Syrian army Base 46 keeps rebels at bay|last=Bar|first=Herve|date=9 October 2012|publisher=Lebanon Daily Star|accessdate=22 November 2012}} On 22 September, rebels seized the adjacent village of [[Urum al-Kubrah]] from "pro-government militias", opening the way to lay siege to the base. Rebels originally thought that Base 46 would fall quickly, but government forces put up a stiff resistance. By 9 October, the rebel offensive against the base had bogged down. Government troops and snipers had occupied a former school building in the adjacent village of [[Kafr Ama]], halting any attempted rebel advance through a nearly {{convert|2|km|mi}} [[no man's land]], while the rebels were battered by government airstrikes and plagued by ammunition shortages and command disputes. Nevertheless, the rebels had succeeded in cutting the base off from land resupply; only helicopters were able to airlift supplies to the besieged troops within the base. General al-Fajj stated that 20 soldiers had defected from the base, who reported that low morale and hunger were causing problems amongst the units trapped in the base. On 14 October 2012, the base's garrison of several hundred soldiers was reported to have been surrounded by rebel forces. Rebels claimed to have shot down a fighter jet nearby on the previous day as they halted a column of government armoured vehicles heading from Aleppo city to relieve the base, one of two failed attempts by the army to relieve the siege in such a manner. On 18 November, rebel forces stormed and entered Base 46, clearing all resistance by the following day. Though banned from serving in General al-Fajj's FSA units, Islamist fighters from the Fajr al-Islam group were one of several rebel groups that participated in the final assault. The base soon came under government air assault after opposition forces forced the government troops out, but rebels managed to hold their gains. Foreign journalists soon were able to visit the base following the end of the battle, confirming the rebel victory.{{cite news|url=http://english.alarabiya.net/articles/2012/11/21/251049.html|title=Syrian rebels set up camp on hilltop Base 46|last=AFP|date=21 November 2012|publisher=Al Arabiya|accessdate=25 November 2012}} ==Aftermath== The base's facilities sustained heavy damage during the siege. All of its buildings were gutted and scarred from small-arms fire and shelling, and at least one major building was destroyed in the final assault. Rebel fighters looted the base of weapons and defaced portraits of President [[Bashar al-Assad]] found in the buildings. Those government soldiers who did not escape were reportedly taken prisoner, though an unknown number were apparently released after agreeing to defect. According to General al-Fajj, "nearly 300" government soldiers were killed during the siege, while around 60 more were taken prisoner. Government dead were buried in mass graves on the base, while al-Fajj stated that the prisoners would be tried for war crimes. Large quantities of [[materiel]] from the base fell into rebel hands. Around 15 tanks and armoured vehicles as well as numerous artillery pieces and rocket launchers were taken by rebels from Base 46 to more secure locations closer to the Turkish border. The equipment haul included a number of [[DShK]] heavy machine guns and around 18 complete [[Strela 2]] [[Man-portable air-defense systems|MANPADs]], both highly useful in anti-aircraft capacities.{{cite news|url=http://www.nowlebanon.com/NewsArticleDetails.aspx?ID=462373|title=Syria’s DIY revolution |last=Weiss|first=Michael|date=1 December 2012|publisher=NOW Lebanon|accessdate=3 December 2012}} The capture of Base 46 has been characterised as a significant strategic victory for opposition forces in northern Syria, showing a higher level of strategic planning and organisation taking form within the FSA. In addition to partially [[Encirclement|encircling]] government forces fighting in Aleppo, the base's capture eliminates another potential supply route for them, while further opening up rebel supply routes coming from [[Turkey]]. The fall of Base 46 additionally has been characterised as important for rebel forces seeking to gain more ground in the [[2011–2012 Idlib Governorate clashes|ongoing battle for Idlib Province]]. Soon after the capture, an army attack helicopter and a MiG fighter jet were shot down by rebels in Aleppo Province using domestically-captured weapons, possibly from Base 46. On 21 November, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights reported that rebels had on the previous day stormed the besieged base of the 111th Regiment at Sheikh Suleiman, located north of Base 46. The success of the assault on Base 46 was not repeated, and opposition fighters were repelled from the area by an army counterattack, in which 25 rebels were killed.{{cite news|url=http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/syrian-army-repels-rebel-attack-on-base-watchdog.aspx?pageID=238&nid=35151&NewsCatID=352|title=Syrian army repels rebel attack on base: watchdog|last=AFP|publisher=Hurriyet Daily News|accessdate=22 November 2012}} However, other opposition activists reported that the rebels managed to temporarily capture half of the base in the attack, allegedly taking a handful of artillery pieces and significant stores of ammunition in the process and declaring the base as functionally "neutralised". Fighting was still ongoing.{{cite news|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2012/11/20/us-syria-crisis-base-idUSBRE8AJ0I620121120?irpc=932|title=Rebels storm military base in north Syria|last=Oweis|first=Khaled Yacoub|author2=Angus MacSwan |publisher=Reuters|date=20 November 2012|accessdate=25 November 2012}} On 27 November, rebels allegedly used surface-to-air missiles seized from Base 46 to shoot down a government helicopter returning to Aleppo from a resupply mission to Sheikh Suleiman.{{cite news|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/2/8/59604/World/Region/Syria-rebels-say-captured-missiles-downed-army-air.aspx|title=Syria rebels say captured missiles downed army aircraft|last=AFP|date=2 December 2012|publisher=Ahram Online|accessdate=7 December 2012}} Sheikh Suleiman finally fell to rebels led by the jihadist group [[Jabhat al-Nusra]] on 10 December.{{cite news|url=http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20121211/world/Jihadists-seize-strategic-north-Syria-army-base.449123|title=Jihadists seize strategic north Syria army base|last=AFP|date=11 December 2012|publisher=Times of Malta|accessdate=13 December 2012}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{Syrian Civil War}} [[Category:Sieges of the Syrian Civil War|Base 46]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War in 2012|Base 46]] [[Category:Aleppo Governorate in the Syrian Civil War]] [[Category:Atarib District]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War involving the Syrian government]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War involving the Free Syrian Army]]
